title: Resume
text:
Download my two-page resume for export [pdf]


Or, view my extended resume here:

title: Quincy Noel
text: I am a motivated, emerging sustainability professional focused on ethical environmental consulting, urban policy, cutting-edge climate solutions, and carbon management. Passionate about social justice, innovation, and collaborative problem-solving, I leverage cross-cultural experience (with Spanish proficiency), strong all-around communication skills, and a unique technical toolkit to translate intersecting topics into comprehensive strategies accessible to diverse audiences. It is my mission to create actionable plans that address global sustainability challenges while generating tangible benefits for local communities.

title: Quincy Noel
text: I am a motivated, emerging sustainability professional focused on ethical environmental consulting, urban policy, cutting-edge climate solutions, and carbon management. title: Quincy Noel
text:
Core Competencies

Leadership & Mentorship: Engaging stakeholders, guiding heterogeneous teams, and fostering inclusive, equity-focused atmospheres that prioritize detail-oriented improvement
Strategic Analysis & Project Management: Rapid comprehension, synthesis, and implementation of multifaceted initiatives with measurable impact
Environmental Data Modeling & Visualization: Trained in ArcGIS Pro/Online, openLCA, R coding, Agriculture and Land Use (ALU) and COMET-Farm software, DayCent modeling, and related tools for mapping projects, life cycle assessments, and carbon inventories
Creative Design: Drawing on a wide range of professional, extracurricular, and educational backgrounds to develop interdisciplinary policy and sustainability solutions that address complex ecological and societal challenges—encompassing energy transitions, climate change, resource efficiency, and biodiversity

title: Quincy Noel
text:
Current Positions
Cross-Cultural Mapping Specialist (Fall 2025 to Present)
Trees, Water & People in Fort Collins, CO

Standardize multilingual survey data (English, Spanish, and French) from Mesoamerica and the Caribbean, and create maps and interactive visualizations (ArcGIS Pro/Online with Experience Builder)
Collaborate with the CSU Geospatial Centroid to ensure mapping quality and data safety
Attend English- and Spanish-language staff meetings to support interdepartmental project coordination and general operations

Assistant Outreach Coordinator (Fall 2025 to Present)
CSU Energy Institute in Fort Collins, CO

Design, carry out, and evaluate educational programming in a mobile classroom focused on clean energy, sustainability, and climate solutions
Plan and run a branch of the annual international KidWind Challenge (Qualtrics)

title: Quincy Noel
text:
Education
Professional Science Master’s, Ecosystem Science & Sustainability (2026)
Carbon Management and Water Resources concentrations (4.0 GPA)
Colorado State University in Fort Collins, CO
Bachelor of Science, Ecosystem Science & Sustainability, cum laude (2025)
Sociology minor (3.88 GPA)
Colorado State University in Fort Collins, CO

title: Projects
text:
Below are descriptions of some of my recent projects from my graduate and undergraduate studies. Unfortunately, much of the work I have produced in my professional roles is private, but these provide a foundational view of my skill set. Click on the links to see the projects themselves.

Project 1 – Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Odell Brewing Company’s Malting-Quality Barley Production and Opportunities for Mitigation (2017-2039) [PDF]

Context: A carbon inventory and mitigation report I wrote for a graduate class at CSU titled “Applications in Greenhouse Gas Inventories”
Primary Tool(s): R coding and IPCC Guidelines (2006)



Project 2 – A New Dawn for Ancient Forests: Rewriting the Future of Old-Growth Forest Management with Stakeholder Input [PDF]

Context: A policy brief I created for a graduate class at CSU titled “Greenhouse Gas Policies”
Primary Tool(s): Project Drawdown



Project 3 – Emission factor determination and application for materials associated with producing beer [URL]

Context: A thesis I produced over the course of my final undergraduate semester at CSU as part of my membership in the Honors Program
Primary Tool(s): openLCA and Microsoft Excel
